content.description: Start crouched with your left hand on the fin and your right hand on a good side pull. Get your feet, move to the rounded jug, finish straight up arête.
content.location: Back side of Jerry Garcia boulder.

content.description: Everyone loves a little techy offwidthy chimney thing every now and again.  Luckily, while this fits the bill, it's still relatively easy.  Another great problem for The Egg easies circuit.
content.location: The chimney to the right of Weather Report and Dark Hollow.  It's on the back side of the two large boulders you first come to when you get to the area.

content.description: Good movement on a cool arete.  Squeeze, pull, work feet, and make a big reach.  It's not the most classic problem in the universe, but it's great as part of The Egg circuit.
content.location: On the little wall to the left of the Jerry Garcia wall, which is on the other large boulder.

content.description: A bit dirty, and you have either choose to stand on the tree stump, or awkwardly avoid it.  So not exactly an Audrey Hepburn, but I'd say it's worth the effort.  Once you are on the rock, it's fun to finish it.
content.protection: One pad.  Not a great landing, really.  But you probably won't fall.
content.location: To the right of the China Cat slab, which is to the right of the Terrapin Station Chimney.  Look for the stump and dusty jugs and slopers.

content.description:
Probably the best hard vertical problem in the Icicle. Start on two of the three slimpers at 7 or 8 feet, and levitate through the badassery. Start is height dependent, so use an extra pad if you need to to reach the start holds. For me, at 5'9", I could barely reach them with a single crash pad under me.

Great jugs and an easy topout lay in wait at the top.
content.protection: 1-2 pads, and would be nice to have a spotter, but can be done with less.
content.location: The most obvious line on approach to Egg Rock. It is in the center of the largest boulder, on the vertical face, and has faint green and red grafiti professing the artist's love of Jerry.

content.description: Climb the short face from a stand start with a tiny left-hand undercling and an even smaller right-hand crimp. Climb up on more crimps.
content.location: On the backside of the Jerry Garcia boulder. Climbs the face.

content.description: Good movement, but most people will probably only experience this as the downclimb from the other climbs.
content.location: Huge holds to the right around the corner of the Jerry Garcia wall.

content.description: Sit start with a flat ledge and make a couple moves straight up.
content.location: The small boulder to the right of the trail between the main cluster and the Musashi boulder, on the other side of Bertha.

content.description:
Hop, skip and a jump.

Start at good hold in middle of face around right from China Cat and Rider, bump to obvious edge, then gun it for the top.

Guidebook mentions variations to left and right, but lots of moss exists there now. Bring a brush and clean things if you're looking for more options (serious bonus pts if you do!)
content.location: Head to the backside of the Garcia boulder, then down a minor slope left after the China Cat/Rider problems.
In the corridor of the Jerry Garcia boulder.
Right side of corridor in the middle of the slab.

content.description:
This problem seems to have lost a key hold.  Since this was practically the only fun hold, the line seems to arbitrarily move through dirty rock on whatever boring holds are there.

That said, the rock does have a cool feeling in this spot.

Let me know if you find something that I didn't.
content.location: Around the corner from Funiculi Funicula.  Look for the best moves and cleanest rock you can find.

content.description:
An odd little problem that sits on the right side of the trail as you leave the lower cluster of Egg boulders and approach the Musashi/Smokestack Lightnin area.

This boulder is short, but has great movement.  I found two distinct ways to do it, both of which felt about v0.

This cryptic highball starts to the left of Estimated Profit on a good left sloper on the arete and a very low right undercling.  Climb straight up to a heady top out.

For a slightly contrived but very fun variation start (Bad Bee Sloper) with the same hands but one or both feet out far right one the flat self start of Estimated Profit.
content.location: Located on the arete in between Estimated Profit and Bertha.

content.description:
Good movement and fun holds, but this problem is rather short.  It's listed as v4 in the Sheridan guide, but I thought it was easier.

A worthy problem to do in The Egg circuit.
content.location: Right side arete of Jerry Garcia wall.
